results.title: Partisans, Wielding Money, Begin Seeking to Exploit Harassment Claims
results.abstract: The earthquake of sexual misconduct allegations has taken down powerful men without regard to politics, but as it shakes Washington, accusations are taking on a partisan tint.

multimedia.caption: Gloria Allred, left, a high-profile women’s rights lawyer and Democratic donor, is raising money to fund a lawsuit against President Trump by Summer Zervos, right, who has said he sexually assaulted her.
multimedia.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Gloria Allred, left, a high-profile women’s rights lawyer and Democratic donor, is raising money to fund a lawsuit against President Trump by Summer Zervos, right, who has said he sexually assaulted her.

results.title: Republicans’ 2018 Resolution: Bipartisanship. Will It Last?
results.abstract: With their Senate majority narrowed even further and a midterm election approaching, Republicans are seeking some consensus with Democrats after a year of intense division.

multimedia.caption: “We’re going to be looking for areas of bipartisan agreement because that’s the way the Senate is,” Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, said this month.
multimedia.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: For Trump, a Glittering Gala Ends a Winter Vacation Rooted in Routine
results.abstract: On New Year’s Eve, Mar-a-Lago hosted its annual gala, an opulent but customary occasion for a president who spent his winter vacation reveling in the comforts of familiarity.
results.byline: By EMILY COCHRANE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

multimedia.caption: President Trump arriving with the first lady, Melania, and their son, Barron, 11, at a New Year’s Eve gala at Mr. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago club in Florida on Sunday night.
multimedia.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: President Trump arriving with the first lady, Melania, and their son, Barron, 11, at a New Year’s Eve gala at Mr. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago club in Florida on Sunday night.

results.title: For Trump, a Year of Reinventing the Presidency
results.abstract: In ways that were once unimaginable, President Trump has discarded the conventions and norms established by his predecessors. Will that change the institution permanently?

multimedia.caption: President Trump has cast aside the mythology of a magisterial presidency removed from the people in favor of a reality-show accessibility.
multimedia.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.title: The Trump Effect: Business, Anticipating Less Regulation, Loosens Purse Strings
results.abstract: The administration’s campaign to reduce regulation has improved the mood of business executives. They may be spending more money as a result.
results.byline: By BINYAMIN APPELBAUM and JIM TANKERSLEY

multimedia.caption: President Trump said last month at a news conference that he had rolled back 22 regulations for every new one.
multimedia.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.title: Mayor de Blasio Begins Second Term in Frigid Ceremony
results.abstract: On a bitterly cold day, Bill de Blasio was sworn by Senator Bernie Sanders and pledged “a new progressive era in this city’s history.”

multimedia.caption: Mr. de Blasio’s second inauguration was truncated because of the fierce cold.

results.title: With Disney Deal Looming, Murdoch’s Empire Is Fractured
results.abstract: Rupert Murdoch’s decision to sell most of 21st Century Fox has many wondering what the future holds for him and the two sons who seemed on the cusp of taking over his vast empire.
results.byline: By BROOKS BARNES and SYDNEY EMBER

multimedia.caption: Rupert Murdoch agreed in December to sell much of 21st Century Fox to the Walt Disney Company, leaving many wondering what the future holds for Mr. Murdoch and his two sons.
multimedia.copyright: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images

results.title: Korean War, a ‘Forgotten’ Conflict That Shaped the Modern World
results.abstract: The three-year conflict set the stage for decades of tension on the Korean Peninsula, but today many Americans know little about it.

multimedia.caption: American troops landing at Pohang, on the east coast of Korea, in July 1950, during the Korean War.

results.title: Pulled Over in a Rental Car, With Heroin in the Trunk
results.abstract: The Supreme Court will hear arguments next week about whether drivers not listed in rental car agreements give up their privacy rights.

multimedia.caption: The Supreme Court is set to decide what happens when a car rental company’s boilerplate contract collides with the Fourth Amendment, which bars unreasonable searches.
multimedia.copyright: Ron Antonelli/Bloomberg

results.title: Courts Must Better Police Themselves on Harassment, Chief Justice Says
results.abstract: In his year-end report on the state of the federal judiciary, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. addressed reports of sexual misconduct by an appeals court judge.

multimedia.caption: Judge Alex Kozinski of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit retired two weeks ago after 15 women accused him of sexual harassment.
multimedia.copyright: J. Emilio Flores for The New York Times
